item.source: I need some help with this script

item.title: I need some help with this script
item.dc:creator: @sonny_bill_9 ``jason
item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

Use code tags.

[code]//Setup the constants below.
//Press the q button to stop this script.

const
Colour = 8675650; //Colour to click? Default colour is white.
Amount = 1; //Amount of times to click? 0 = Infinite.
LeftC = True; //Left click? True = Left Click, False = Right Click.
TLevel = 5; //Tolerance level for colour? Leave 0 for no tolerance.
WaitTime = 10000; //Time to wait between clicks at a certian location in milliseconds
var
i, c, x, y, xs, ys, LastClickX, LastClickY: Integer;

begin
GetClientDimensions(xs, ys);
c:=Amount;
repeat
if(FindColorTolerance(x, y, Colour, 0, 0, xs, ys, TLevel)) then
begin
if x = (not(LastClickX)) then
if y = (not(LastClickY)) then
begin
ClickMouse(x, y, True);
LastClickX := x;
LastClickY := y;
wait(2000)
i:=i+1;
end else
wait(WaitTime)
x := 0;
y := 0;
end;
if(Amount<1) then
c:=c+1;
Until (IsKeyDown(‘q’));
end.[/code]

I made it so that if it finds the same location directly after the previous click, it will wait the specified wait time and search again but with the coordinates reset.

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help with this script

item.title: I need some help with this script
item.dc:creator: @cyberfreaker cyberfreaker
item.description:
@cyberfreaker wrote:

Hi im new to Scar and to scripting,
but i found this script in one of the Scar forum,
Id like to add something to the code but everytime I try i mess up the code,

this is what it does:
searches for the color: 8675650 and clicks on it.

this is what id like to add to the code:
to not reapeat locations of searched and clicked color for a periode of time

and this is the sript:

[code]program ColourClicker;
//Setup the constants below.
//Press the q button to stop this script.

const
Colour = 8675650; //Colour to click? Default colour is white.
Amount = 1; //Amount of times to click? 0 = Infinite.
LeftC = True; //Left click? True = Left Click, False = Right Click.
TLevel = 5; //Tolerance level for colour? Leave 0 for no tolerance.

var
i, c, x, y, xs, ys: Integer;

begin
GetClientDimensions(xs, ys);
c:=Amount;
repeat
if(FindColorTolerance(x, y, Colour, 0, 0, xs, ys, TLevel)) then
ClickMouse(x, y, LeftC);
wait(2000)
i:=i+1;
if(Amount<1) then
c:=c+1;
Until (IsKeyDown(‘q’));
end.[/code]

thanks in advance.

Read full topic
